page.title: 05WELSH LANGUAGE
page.content: The block is in a Welsh speaking area but less than twenty five percent of the inhabitants of the district speak Welsh and are therefore bi-lingual. Some of the people are able to understand Welsh but are unable to speak or write the language. The children are taught Welsh in Primary School and some of them go on to a Welsh Secondary School where all the teaching is done through the medium of the Welsh language. In this respect some of the children are bi-lingual whereas their parents are not. As more English speaking only people move into the area the Welsh language is used less and it is feared that unless greater effort is made to learn Welsh it will eventually become extinct in the area.
